intro: Paepalanthus stuetzelii, commonly known as the Stützel's pincushion cactus, is a species native to the arid regions of South America. It is characterized by its dense, spiny clusters of stems that resemble a pincushion, giving it its common name. The plant produces small, white flowers during the warmer months, which are typically clustered at the ends of the stems. It is well adapted to drought conditions, storing water in its fleshy stems. This cactus is often found in rocky soils and is a popular choice for xeriscaping due to its low maintenance and unique appearance.
